reviews.text: Excellent selection of classic military trainer and combat aircraft. Very helpful service. I also love how they restore and maintain all of the aircraft that they have there in an effort to preserve U.S. and World Aviation history. The prices to enter are very fair for all the cool stuff you get to see and they even offer a discount for military. All around would recommend to any history or aviation buff.

Although I have been here several times, this time my kids bought me a ride in a T-6 for Christmas. I literally cannot say enough good about these guys. The experience was nothing short of amazing. The crew went well out of their way to make it a terrific experience, reassuring my wife that I would make it back alive, explaining the process and history of the aircraft, and showing general hospitality that was above and beyond. My pilot also went above and beyond to make my experience fun. He did an amazing job of piloting the aircraft while tending to my experience as well. Top notch piloting! As for the facility and displays, the place is immaculate. The displays are clean and well arranged and it is really noteworthy how nice the aircraft look. A good variety of types that offer a highlight of military aviation. Well done guys, well done.

I LOVE the planes, wow I love them. I wish the Cavanaugh Flight Museum had more people interested in it or was in a more high traffic's area. It seems like it could benefit from some modernizatio of its lobby areas and gift shop, but all around a wonderful and beautiful tribute to the history of modern aviation.

Despite the small overall size, this museum still features a fascinating variety of exhibits. The interior aircraft are visually pristine and many are still functional. The descriptions in particular are very detailed and well written. This compensated for the lack of official guides during my visit.

To see a history of aviation - military and otherwise - was amazing! My 16-year-old nephew thoroughly enjoyed the experience. To see and touch planes that actually flew missions during WWII was incredible!
Place was super busy on a Sunday morning. We waited maybe 10 minutes to be seated when we thought it would be much longer. The wait for the food was not long either. Can't go wrong with IHOP.
Very good food. I had the chicken florentine crepes. Well done. Nice waitress.
Good food. Nice to have a place close by that's open 24 hours
Pancakes were very good. The put a lot of milk in the scrambled eggs. The waitress seemed new, she wasn't as attentive as needed to be.
My kids love this place and it always helps when you have a great waitress......Thank you Denise for putting up with my children, lol

We will call in our order about twice a month! We could not be any happier! You do have to get double cheese burger cause they are juicier then then the single! Great phone service never have to wait on food and most of all my fellas are happy and that makes momma happy! Keep up the great job!

Jake's has some serious nostalgia for me. I have gone to the Jake's in Plano (no closed) with my best friend since high school. To me, Jake's tastes like friendship.

The burger is great, but I highly recommend the Flaming Rooster with Jake's Fries.

I love the new Frisco location! The bar is HUGE, and I really like the way they've fused the old bar look with a modern style.

The service isn't perfect, but it's not bad either, and the food is well worth it.

Jake's Special:  Here is the first burger they brought me. I seem to think my Jalapeño burger is missing something? While not the burger I ordered, it's still a good burger...perhaps in another review I shall eat one? Alas, not at this location. For you are a phony Jakes! A big fat phony!
Great bar burgers, good drinks, and an awesome patio. Great staff too, friendly and cute girls, fun bartenders.  They also have very good breakfast.

I wanted a good burger for lunch and what I got was inedible. Upon entering Jake's my father & I were greeted by 3 young women who were dressed for the ho stroll not work, though to be fair i think those are "uniforms." The service was poor. I ordered a mushroom & swiss burger. Not halfway through my burger it fell apart. While chewing the "meat" I bit down on something hard. Not gristle hard but marble hard. This happened twice while eating and i put down the burger. Bottom line is the burger was gross.

The food was good and fast! The 
Staff was great! I had the beef bowl special! My wife had spicy beef bowl! We also had shrimp rolls and Vietnamese egg rolls! I especially like  the ice coffee! But I have to have lots of sweet milk since I do not like the taste of coffee! Our waiter did a great job of making sure I was able to get just the right flavor!

One of my favorite places for quality vietnamese food. Great hospitality. I've had nothing but great experiences here and will keep coming back. Prices were appropriate. Ambience is similar to Fresno's scene.
Excellent location for Vietnamese food. Service is always timely even when they have a full house. Definitely worth a return visit. Prices are fair.

Vietnamese food here - very good. Good place to hang and eat some good food. I had a cousin come into town and asked me to take him back here. Prices were reasonable. Menu is similar to a restaurant in El Paso I loved.
Vietnamese food at this location - super good. Very tasty. The service here is above par. Wish it was closer to my house, I would come every week.

Good food 🥘 Veg spring rolls 🤤 I have ordered Basil Fried Rice 🍛, the taste is okay. I didn’t feel like good sticky rice 🍚 and it tasted normal. Taste can be improved a bit better for fried rices. Overall experience is good. Ambiance and Service is very good. Nice to visit in a while.

Lunch was really very tasty -- green curry chicken.  This should have been a quick 45 minute lunch.  But after 20 minutes waiting for our order and not getting the attention of our waitress,  we had to get up and ask where was our order, only to find out that the waitress lost our order and didn't remember what we ordered so she had to ask for it again.  So service is below par and way slow, the decor and menus have seen their better day, but the food was tasty.
ordered the spicy crispy soy beef with brown rice. large servings, great taste and reasonable prices. will visit again while in Addison
Drop by for a quick work day dinner, ordered spicy stir fried flat noodle.  4.5 star service, 3 star food. Reasonable price, Willing to try other dish next time hoping better taste

Delicious, quick, and (usually) accurate and friendly. Fantastic vegan proteins. The one thing I would suggest is working on your noodle dishes, that section of the menu is a bit bland compared to everything else.

Just like the one at home. They have huge screens and are a good size for large parties. They can accommodate a large group. Please call in advance for large parties. Good selection at the bar, all your favorite drinks and some local brew. I went back the next day and was treated just as good. I liked the service and the staff was really trying to get me everything I asked for.

The food is set by the company, and the back end fulfills their end of the deal by making great, casual food. However, the front end customer service leaves something to be desired. Too long to come back to table. Little menu knowledge (this has been on three occasions in the past month). If you want to watch the game and dont care about customer service, then 5 stars.
The patron was very attentive and very helpful. The appetizers were delicious and the pulled pork sandwich could have used less salt but overall good. There were no images due to the gobbled up food.
The food was good but what made the experience even better was our server!! She was amazing... just wished I could remember her name.  I would hire her in a heartbeat

Atmosphere is their main attraction. The wings are ok. Let's face it you go for the drinks and sports.  However the burger never disappoints.  Bloody Mary could use some tweaking.  I've had better. Can't mess up the draft drinks. Service is slow so order a drink before you get to the glass half-empty.

Had brunch for the first time! Brunch menu was delicious and just right amount of food! Sat at the bar. Great and friendly service. Love the bean dip that comes to the table with chips and salsa. Brunch food came out fast. I definitely will come back for brunch again and will highly recommend this place to friends and family.

This place is great! It has a hint of authenticity with the tad of flair. Staff is super nice and they wear these fancy little shirts. I've never gone to this place and felt disappointed with my food. Even if I tried something new. It may not have been what I wanted or was in the mood for but it never let me down. They have a couple of pretty good drinks too. Check them out! I doubt you'll be disappointed!

Gloria's is one of my favorite restaurants and this location was not my usual location to go. Food tasted great as I expected. I enjoyed the Salsa dancing after the restaurant hours at this location. We didn't wait too long to get seated on a Friday night for a party of 10. I decided to try something different this time.and it tasted good. Yucca and plantain.

This restaurant apparently is "the" place to be on a Friday night for dinner and dancing. Once the guests have finished eating, they sit and talk. Large parties must wait until 80% of everyone is there before being seated. (understandingly) Parking is difficult because of the other restaurants in the same area. But, it's a very good experience. 👍

My favorite Latin dance joint. I like that it switches back and forth between the live salsa band and the DJ mix. It gives you a nice variation of dancing for everyone. I would definitely dress well to come to this location. Last I remember they do have a dress code, at least for the late night dancing they certainly do. In terms of the food service, the food is hit or miss honestly. It used to be a lot better 8-10 years ago, but I feel there have been a lot of changes and the food just isn't quite what it used to be. I recommend the pupusas, the fajita nachos, and the Salvadorian sampler/mix plate (I can't remember exactly what it's called). The drinks are definitely better than the food here so make sure to order a margarita or cocktail drink as that is their strong suit. You don't need more than 2 to have a great evening.
I loved the BBQ Pork Fried Rice. We also shared Pan-Fried dumplings. The best dumplings I ever had. May Dragon is by far way better than the local Chinese food restaurants.   This was delicious!

One of my fav places for delicious Chinese food. Do yourself a favor and give this place a try. I look forward to a return visit. This place has a cool atmosphere. Menu is like a place in San Francisco I liked.

I use to come here a few yrs ago and a lot but food quality faded and so did the service. Took a date there that really wanted to try it. The food was really good and the service top notch. I asked for her name because when good service received I want to be able to get it again. Probably spelling it wrong but think it's Vinca? Short hair female. Anyways, I showed her a picture of something someone previously ordered online. Her attention to detail was on point and was glad to enjoy May Dragon. Thank you for your service and and the cooks in the back this March 2019. Yall made me want to make this my regular place again.
I went to this restaurant for the first time with my sponsor the accommodations were very nice, the atmosphere was upscale, and the food was very good. Overall I had a great time. Thank you.
Nice little hidden gem. Solid food, I had the lemon chicken. Soft, quiet atmosphere. Good service.

I can't say enough wonderful things about this elegant restaurant. Starting with the atmosphere it is a cozy and inviting place. The staff is very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. They have a full bar as well as a huge verity of wines. Whether it is your first or many visits they make you feel very welcome. The quality of the food is amazing very fresh and tasty.

Great Neighborhood Restaurant Specializing in French Cuisine at a Reasonable Price. Service was friendly and very professional. Atmosphere was conducive to romantic meals, gatherings of friends, as well as business. Food was on par with some of the other fine French Restaurants in Dallas. Highly recommend giving them a try.

This is the BEST place for people sensitive to loud restaurants and don’t like to be rushed. Perfect price point.

The only place i know in DFW for elegant, quiet dining and great food. ...aside from Old Warsaw. 
Ali is the best. I love this little place and the food they serve.

I have read people state how reasonable the prices are. That it is not. HOWEVER. The food was exquisite. The service was phenomenal. The mood was beyond satisfying.  If you want a wonderful experiance with a loved one. I highly recommend. But do not expect to leave this restaurant spending less than 100$ for 2 people. With that said. The escargot starter is a must have. All the food in general was beyond gratifying.
A preferred place for french food. It was so appetizing. The place has a great feel to it. I see why this place has so many good reviews.

We were looking forward to a good steak but were blown away by the quality and selection on the menu.  Our waiter, Jason, was superb.  From the professional, welcoming greet as we walked through the door (in somewhat casual clothes), to Jason's help with the wine list and menu selection it was by and far the nicest dinner outing I have ever experienced.  We chose veal chops for our main entree and they were fabulous.  We enjoyed several glasses of wine, and of course took the Uber back to the hotel.  Five stars.

What can you say about Chamberlain's Steak House that everyone and Dallas already does not know. Well, for those that do t this is a great place to take your wife, girlfriend or business Associate. The atmosphere is great the food is great and the service is absolutely the best, food is great the bread they bring before your meal is unbelievable. And steaks what can I say I had the bone in New York 14 oz. And it was amazing definitely will come back!

First time visiting Dallas and Chamberlain Steak and Chop House. Very nice atmosphere and easy to find.  I  would recommend you reserve a t able ahead of time so you do not have to wait. Valet parking is available but not needed. We were promptly seated and the staff was very friendly.The crab cakes  were delicious and the steaks were perfectly charred. I am a big Charley's fan and this place was comparable.  I would recommend this steakhouse if you are in the area.

From the moment we arrived everyone was friendly, "welcoming us as family", the food and service was excellent. The chef stopped by our table, Richard Chamberlain, stopped by our table, to make sure we were pleased with our meals.  Our waiter could not have done a better Job. Would highly recommend !

Excellent food and service(we had Shay who was phenomenal)! From the time we walked in up until we left, everyone was friendly, prompt, and the food came out quickly and was superb. For reference, we had the prime rib, New York strip 14oz, shared a chop house salad, and also had the lobster deviled eggs as the starter(last 3 all pictured). 

I highly recommend this place if you're looking for a nice night out with great food!

I went to this place to take my wife out.  Let me tell you, the salad bar is amazing!!  I love the meats, but I could go for the salad bar alone.  Great choices, and it's kept fresh.  Server was great and staff was very attentive.  I felt like I was in a different state while I was there.  The meats we're good as well, and it was brought by real fast.  Didn't have to wait long.  The Managers were constantly checking to make sure everything was tip top.  I will be back

It was my birthday and they really made it special with the desert! The chocolate mousse cake with the ice cream it's delicious!! The wide variety of meats available are also cooked to perfection! The buffet is a great size and in a good space where it's not crowded. The ambiance in the restaurant is quiet and relaxed. All of the staff were extremely friendly and the offer military discount! I will be back!

Food quality was great. Everything was fresh, the managers made sure my experience was exceptional. I love the cheese bread and the bananas the salad bar was amazing. I would highly recommend this establishment. Thank you. You have mad one pregnant woman very happy. I appreciate the kitchen and wait staff for making sure the meat was cooked to the temperature I wanted it. Also they kept my drink full the whole time service was excellent.

We went here for a company dinner.  Service was good and the food was typical.  Way too much of it.  This place I feel is just like any of the other meat parade places.  It's good but the unlimited nature pushes the cost up and sometimes, I really just don't want that much food.  The salad bar had some interesting options on it but of course we all know that is just to fill you up so you eat less meat.

I'm not so much a meat eater, but my family/friends and I had a great time here. There's something for every one, including me! It's always great spending time with family/friends, but even better at a place that is so welcoming with great staff and amazing food/drinks. We will be back!

I remember seeing the name and thinking "maybe this is some discount place or all you can eat buffet".  I was wrong!  This place is nice inside with a wonderful atmosphere.  Fish is fresh, tasty, and their service is excellent.  I have yet to have a bad night there.  Average prices for sushi, but the quality is well worth the price you pay.

Has great service. Servers are very attentive and friendly. Food was good and satisfying. I'd would had given a 5 stars if it wasnt for-
1. I feel that the portion of the food for its price... was a bit too small. $9 for combo fried rice, I could had gotten a bigger portion else where for that price. 
2. Our sushi kept falling apart, all of them. Maybe it was just that particular day or the chef working but none stayed intact. 

Overall, it's a good establishment. No complaints other than size of entree (not sushi).

We have eaten at Mr. Sushi for many years. The price is very fair compared to other sushi shops, but the service and quality beats everyone else. We've tried a lot of places over the years and always end up comparing them to Mr. Sushi. I love the more traditional atmosphere and attire. I also enjoy the serenade when there's a birthday. So fun! I also appreciate that most of the staff has been the for many years. It's so nice to see the same smiling, gracious faces when you walk in. Our favorites are the Addison tower, volcano rolls, eel sushi, baby scallops, albacore, fresh salmon, and Mr. Sushi rolls.
Most authentic and delicious Japanese food in town. Great date night spot. Fast and polite service in a beautiful atmosphere. Try the Mr. Sushi Roll!

There are many sushi places like Mr. Sushi but this is My Sushi place! I particularly love practicing my Japanese with my Chef's. I adore it when they give me a hard time and tell me they are all out of salmon skin and I make them laugh when I act surprised when my salmon skin roll appears in front of me magically. :-) This is My Sushi place...
